channel.title: buildapc on Roy Tang
channel.description: Recent content in buildapc on Roy Tang

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Posted on r/buildapc: Is a GTX970 worth it if I dont plan to play at ridiculously high resolutions or anything like 4k gaming?

Trying to decide between splurging on a GTX970 or just settling for a GTX750Ti for now and possibly upgrading in the future. I’m not one of those guys who plans to play at really high resolutions or need to have ultra settings all the time, so I’m not sure if the high end one will be worth it. Thoughts?

The rest of my build, if that matters:

Case Thermaltake Versa H25 PSU Seasonic S12II Bronze 620W CPU Intel Core i5-4460 MB ASUS H97MPLUS RAM 2x DDR3 Kingston HyperX Fury 8gb 1600 VC Palit GTX970 Jetstream OC 4gb ddr5 SSD Samsung 850Evo 250gb HDD Seagate 2tb

item.title: New note
item.author: hello@roytang.net (Roy Tang)
item.description:
Posted on r/buildapc: Hello, planning to build a PC soon. Have put together a list of parts available from my local shop

Case Thermaltake Versa H25

PSU Corsair V650W

CPU Intel Core i5-4460

MB ASUS H81M-D

RAM 2x DDR3 Kingston HyperX Fury 8gb 1600

VC Inno3d GTX970 4gb

SSD Kingston V300 240gb

HDD Toshiba/Seagate 2tb SATA

Does this seem fine? I’m not sure if I have to consider anything about the power supply, or if any of these components have a bad reputation or something. Thanks!
